Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: winthor
Reviews.Content: This was one of the lower priced hotels in the Conando area. The hotel itself was in decent shape, with the room and hallways needing freshing up (paint/carpets/etc.), but overall the hotel was clean and comfortable, I found teh elevator to be quick and usually available. The room had blackout curtains, iron/board, and a refrigerator. It also had a safe, but I could not get it to close....not sure if it was only a problem in my room or if they are all nonworking. I did not use the wifi, but the computer in the lobby seemed to have issues. The breakfast was typical (toast/cereal/sausage/coffee/juice) but eating on the roof was very pleasant, especially for those who smoke. The area outside the hotel was occupied by a few homeless/panhandlers, they rarely approached me, as them seemed more interested in the people struck in traffic as the motorists attempted to get on the highway on ramp. The location was three blocks to shopping/restaurtants/beach, and seemed relatively safe as the nearby restaurants were open until after midnight and there was usually people around. The hotel staff were efficient in calling for cabs and dispensing information about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us”
Reviews.Author: lucy14_149
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Portal Hotel a few years ago and this was my first stay since it became a Quality Inn. I found the hotel to be clean and good enough for my short stay. I booked a triple room ( 2 adults + child) and found that the full size bed was a bit small for 2 adults. We ended up beeing just two so we had our own bed (full size + single). The room had a TV, coffee maker (coffee + tea bags), iron, ironing board and a small refrigerator. The bathroom was small but clean and there were shampoo, conditioner and soap. The breakfast was on the roof top of the hotel and was very good. They had boiled eggs, sausage, cereals, pastries,bread, juices, coffee and milk. You could eat as much as you wanted so for me that was a good deal as it was complimentary. At most hotels a regular breakfast fare is around $15. We ordered pizza from the restaurant adjacent to the hotel and it was very good. We spent the day at the mall so we had a light dinner there before heading back to the hotel. The lobby has a vending machine where you can purchase sodas and water. All in all we had a good stay at this hotel. The staff was helpful with any questions that we had. We met a lot of people going on cruises so I think this hotel is popular with cruisers. We stayed at this hotel in january 2012. I rated this hotel as average because it is an old building but I would recommend it to anyone going on a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Food, Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: WMB7
Reviews.Content: Quality Inn El Portal has a rooftop lounge devoted to breakfast providing unique views of the cityscape while dining during their free breakfast. The hotel is a short walk from the beach, several restaurants in addition to being situated at a major crossroads that taxis frequent. The staff was marvelous and made every attempt to make guest feel comfortable and welcome. I would highly recommend this place for a basic lodging in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries”
Reviews.Author: obsSouthampton
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk, a young lady named Lee (tho she may spell it differently) made a good impression by being being efficient, smiling, conversational, able to offer recommendations for restaurants and to speak English. She spent some idle hours sitting on the front steps during the evening chatting to friends but always gave us a greeting when we walked in or out. One big asset in the hotel is the rooftop breakfast bar, where you can eat a good breakfast and get great views of the Condado coast and its various landmark buildings. There is a particularly impressive art-deco style high-rise next door.The staff sometimes work solo or in pairs and may need reminding to wipe tables or replenish coffee at busy times, but they are efficient when they do. The pizza restaurant attached to the hotel on the ground floor gives friendly service in a 'vibrant' atmosphere, which means lots of locals enjoying loud conversation. The hotel is five minutes walk from the west end of Condado beach, along which you can walk in either direction and find somewhere to lie in the sun or swim, tho the power of the waves was rather offputting for the latter during our stay. It is a pleasant walk westwards(anti-clockwise from the hotel) over the causeway and back along the lagoon... the hotel has very good free maps of the area and of Old San Juan. As the hotel has the airport to the east and Old San Juan and the cruise piers to the west, it is a great location for onward travellers. Our room accommodation could not be faulted for the price; the only thing necessary in our room would perhaps be re-carpeting. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in the Condado district.

Reviews.Title: “Economic, clean and wonderfully located.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn was one of the more affordable options we found online looking for hotels before traveling. We were not disappointed at all. The room is simple & clean w/ a very comfortable bed. The television is on the smaller side as is the bathroom but they are adequate for what you need. There is a mini-fridge and substantial storage space (one dresser + a closet for handing clothes), as well. Our stay came with a continental breakfast. It was decent but the logistics left much to be desired. The hotel does not have a restaurant per se so they stage the breakfast on the rooftop. The view is spectacular but it is very windy (paper plates and plastic cups easily flew from the table) and a small space. In short, we found the Quality Inn to be a good value in the heart of the Condado neighborhood. If you're looking for a more luxurious experience, check out the other places that cost much more.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Knowledgeable Staff”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn El Portal for four days during our Puerto Rico trip in February 2012. It's a clean, confortable, mid-range hotel in the Condado area that is very convenient to restaurants and the beach. We enjoyed the fresh pastries served for breakfast each morning as part of the continental breakfast on the hotel's roof. (Breakfast also included cereal, waffles, fresh fruit, and hard-boiled eggs.) We were especially impressed by the helpfulness and knowlege of Mr. Domingo Morales on the hotel's desk staff. This was our first visit to Puerto Rico, so we had many questions about the bus, rental cars, restaurants, and excursions. Almost before we could frame a question, Mr. Morales would provide the answer and solution to our problem!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Qualis_Rex
Reviews.Content: I didn't plan to stay in this hotel during my stay to San Juan, but my experience at the previous hotel was so incredibly horrible I booked a room here the next day. The staff is extremely nice, the view of the sea/El Condado from the roof-top during breakfast was amazing, the beds were comfortable AND CLEAN. It's an older building, but I was very satisfied all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Cliff B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the begining and the end of a cruise trip to the Carribean. We had no problems with our first room ... at least not with bed bugs but it stunk... but apprently the second room had bed bugs and both my wife and I had bites. We only discovered this when we returned to our home. This was the final straw. The hotel is an older facility and our past experience with Quality Inns has always been very good. This hotel was a disaster. The staff was OK but the facility is way beyond needing maintenance. It appears they have defered any and all maintainance...the floors in the public areas were peeling and dirty, the terace contenental breakfast area was not kept clean, the towel holder in our bathroom wouldn't stay on the wall! I can't recomend this hotel to anyone in the future. Don't stay here ... Even though it's close to the beach and close to several recommend eating establishments I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Fer L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. It's right in the middle of everywere. Only about 2-3 blocks from the beach. Free breakfast every morning on the terrace on the 7th floor with a great view!!! Very clean and the staff were nice and helpful. We had no complaints. The hotel is located in a good area, restaurants and shops are just a short walk away. Old San Juan is not that far away...you can take a cab for abut 10-15 bucks or take the bus for only75 cents.

Reviews.Title: “My Priceline BEST Deal Spot! Don't miss the GORGEOUS rooftop!!!”
Reviews.Author: GringaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I seem to "win" this place a lot when I do a Priceline-Name-Your-Own-Price deal...yes, the hallways could use remodeling but it's a nice low-key quiet spot in the middle of EVERY place you'd want to go in San Juan! Great trendy upscale pizza spot just opened next door! It doesn't have a pool but the beach is close by!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Very clean”
Reviews.Author: jrodz02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Inn El Portal Last September for one night before leaving on a cruise. The service is was not friendly but also not rude. The front desk clerk at night just treated us like cattle. Just checked us in, gave us the key and told us what floor the room was in. The clerk in the morning was a little friendlier. The room was very nice clean, not too big and not too small. Everything was just fine. In the morning we went to the roof to have breakfast. Let me tell you, the breakfast was great!! They had eggs, sausage, Puerto Rican coffee, Puero Rican yogurt, waffles, and more food that I cannot remember. It definitely made up for the clerk the night before. This place is close to major shopping mall, and stores. It is a five minute walk to the beach. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting PR.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: bluestocking78
Reviews.Content: Very courteous and helpful staff, close to Condado. Our room was quiet and clean ( 7th floor) - the only noise was in the morning when they started to get ready for breakfast overhead. One caveat- very little hotel parking. We had a rental car and arrived early and did get a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great and simple.”
Reviews.Author: DV V
Reviews.Content: Stayed before and after our cruise. The hotel is great overall. Excellent location, can get a little noisy from the street below during the day, but less traffic at night. Like others mentioned, if you expect luxury, this is not the place for you, but if you need a good hotel at a good price, this is it. You get continental breakfast included, kind of basic, but works. You have a work station in the lobby with internet, and a complimentary coffee, expresso and hot chocolate machine in the lobby as well. The rooms are small, but nice and very clean. Please keep in mind that it is an old building, but nothing really affected our stay. Very good location and just a few minutes from the airport, port and old san juan. Domingo and Stefano are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Great Place to Stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Matthew B
Reviews.Content: If you want something pricey and luxurious, go somewhere else. If you want a quiet, affordable, safe, clean, convenient place to stay while you spend your days touring San Juan, this hotel is great. The staff are friendly, courteous and helpful, as others have noted. The hotel is within convenient walking distance to the stores, restaurants and beaches on Ashburn, and it is within easy walking distance of Old San Juan if you like to walk (around 3-4 miles I would guess). The free continental breakfast (7:00-10:00 a.m.) is delightful. The terrace is also a great place with a cool breeze and wonderful view if you want to just kick back and relax a bit, perhaps after a long hike. There is a neat indoor/sidewalk restaurant next door which serves very good sandwiches and salads. There are also other restaurants just down the street. This was my first trip to San Juan, and I will certainly want to stay at this hotel if and when I return, which I hope to do.

Reviews.Title: “Best value...great location”
Reviews.Author: jdkv
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel but at a good price. The breakfast on the roof deck is free to guest and satisfying. The staff is very friendly. 3 blocks or so top the beach, great restaurants, and casinos in the Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, safe in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Juan quite a lot, I'd say this property is similar to a simple business person's hotel, sort of like a basic Day's Inn kind of place. Yes, the hallway carpets need to be replaced but my room was perfectly clean, housekeeping was great and I felt safe at all times (I'm a woman traveling solo). I WOULD suggest bringing earplugs to ensure good sleep since the hotel in not far from a main intersection. The restaurant/panadaria "Pelayo" next door feels like a chic Los Angeles cafe...great ppl watching!!! I'm returning here in two moths, Miguel the Manager is great as are Stefano and Cydmarie!!! Also, nice to have a fridge and coffee maker in the room and free cafe con leche in the lobby. Not a fancy place, not a resort but close to the beach and felt intimate and homey!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: euromagz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is affordable and it is walking distance to the beach. The area around the hotel itself is so so and I was a little weary at nights. I stayed there by myself and it was ok but if I came with my daughter I would pay more and stay at the Hilton that is right on the beach. The staff there overall was nice especially Domingo. There was only one female receptionist there that wasn't pleasant who sat around the lobby with strangers without greeting guests. I felt very uncomfortable as I didn't know who those people were. That said it is one of those hotels that is ok if you plan on not staying inside much and venture out all day without breaking the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Freaking Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Douglas S
Reviews.Content: My visit to San Juan, Puerto Rico was great! My best friend and I stay there for one week and the staff at Quality Inn El Portal are amazing! Miguel, Lee, Sidmarie, everyone was fantastic!!! We didnt have to rent a car because we were walking distance from just about everything. I am currently planning another visit Dec 1st and will be back at this hotel for my second visit. GREAT LOCATION AND AWESOME STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but simple”
Reviews.Author: yorugua
Reviews.Content: The location is good near Condado area restaurants, pubs and casinos. The beach is a few blocks away. The place is safe. The breakfast is very simple, in an open area where you can not stay when it rains. The hallways are noisy. Only recommended for low budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Concado Beach.”
Reviews.Author: gulliver4u
Reviews.Content: The breakfast room was on the roof top terrace with an awesome view and cooling breeze. The building was older, but very clean and well maintained. The staff was helpful and was willing to give advice on site seeing. The hotel was maybe four or five blocks from the beach, but definitely not a long walk. Parking was a pain. They have very limited parking on site, and a few spots in a lot down the street. But, again, for the price and the experience, it was well worth it. I called from my rental car for directions, and Stefan stayed with me on the phone all the way from the airport. Here is a hint, Verizon Wireless doesn't offer data coverage in PR, so my GPS on my phone did not work at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great staff”
Reviews.Author: ElliottRING
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to airport and Old San Juan. We took the bus (bring quarters, no dollar bills-- 75c per person) to Old San Juan. There is no need to rent a car. This hotel is a short walk (close) to the beach Continental breakfast kept us full. Never had breakfast outdoors, very nice and very picturesque bring your camera. We were able to leave our extra luggage with property during our cruise as we were staying one extra night after the cruise. Contact management before your trip and they will take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy... The Facility, The Location and The Staff”
Reviews.Author: SueandJimRiedle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first two nights and the last night of our marvelous, first time, (nine-day) Puerto Rican vacation at this facility. The price of the room was certainly reasonable. Located just off Expressway 26 in the very pleasant Condado District it was only an 8-10 min. ride from the airport in light traffic. And, itâ€™s just a short walk to the beach. The Condado district has a really nice variety of interesting, reasonably priced restaurants each of which features both typical Puerto Rican cuisine and the usual mainland America selections. There is easy access to Old San Juan by car - we used the public transit system that operates from only a few short blocks from the hotel. Better-than-than-average morning breakfasts on the rooftop terrace are a particularly inviting way to start the day. Management and staff from all three shifts were pleasant, responsive and particularly helpful with info about restaurants, sightseeing and directions to both local and out-of-town destinations. They were more like our travel partners than tourism resources. Overall, the facility (including our rooms) was neat and clean. A significant, non-intrusive, renovation program is underway and management is well aware of the need for updating the hallway carpeting (certainly not a "go-no-go" item), but everything about our rooms and the facility itself was just fine. We scored a parking spot adjacent to the hotel entrance for the first two nights. On our way back home through SJ, we used one of the hotelâ€™s spots in the easy access, gated parking lot conveniently located just around the corner from the facility. All-in-all Q.I./E.P. scored very well compared to our lodging experiences around the U.S and abroad. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if at all possible”
Reviews.Author: MarylandLadyBug
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much when making this reservation, and still ended up being dissappointed. I agree with a previous reviewer that this Quality Inn lacks quality. The one positive I can list if the free buffet breakfast everywhere, which included more than danishes and juice. There are mini waffles, sausages, crossaints, etc. Do take advantage of this. Other than this however, the room is outdated and not the most clean. The staff is rude and obnoxious. We had to speak with the manager about this. Although the manager was friendly and receptive, one of his front desk staff named Lee was not. She rolled her eyes and snatched the credit card from us after realizing she had made a mistake in our payment and had to correct it. Then she called over another employee to complain in Spanish in front of us, not realizing I am fluent in Spanish. We were only staying here 1 1/2 days due to the resort we truly came to stay being at capacity for the first day of our arrival, and we knew this going in. Still we will not be back and do not recommend this hotel. For the price paid and the quality, stay at a Super 8 or pay $40 more and stay at a 4 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price.”
Reviews.Author: JBATrojan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night just the other day. As long as you remember that it is a Quality Inn and not a five-star all-inclusive, it's a great place. Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast had better selection than most I've been to. The location is convenient to the Condado Beach. Make sure you have good directions - it is a hard hotel to find if you don't have a good idea of how to get there beforehand. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Inn Lacks So Much Quality!"”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeanmomof2
Reviews.Content: I'm not the type to nit-pick and complain about every little thing like some of the tourists on these sites, however I must say that this time I was really disappointed in this "cheap" hotel. The carpets were horrific. Worn, smelly, old and gross. It feels as if at least 50,000 people have been through this hotel. They definitely, undoubtedly need BRAND NEW CARPETS! Steam cleaning sure as hell won't work! Besides this huge flaw, the breakfast of course is not a real breakfast: bread, burnt mini waffles, mini sausages, mini cereal, packets of strawberry jam, cheap yogurt, old and hard mini croissants. Plus rude female staff that stare at you while taking "breakfast" and doesn't have manners. I thought "Morning" was universal :-s The hotel personnel were okay. They obviously aren't too excited to be working there. Sometimes, there is no personnel. When the one person leaves, that's it, fend for yourselves. Overall, just very upset and not used to such conditions. Like most people say the $100 the night isn't worth it. Book your trip in advance and stay at a 3 star hotel (in San Juan, anything less and its crappy and worn).

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for pre -cruise”
Reviews.Author: dalm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn El Porto for 1 night pre-cruise. It was just fine for that but I wouldnâ€™t want to vacation there. The hallways are dark with very old carpet that looks kind of ratty but the rooms are much lighter & clean. Itâ€™s a functional Quality Inn but nothing fancy. The rooftop breakfast was a nice treat & the view is pretty impressive. The WiFi in the room works fine but you may have to call the desk for the user name & password because itâ€™s not in the room. They still have the old plug in dial up thing. If you need it, there are a few cute little restaurants behind the hotel. There isnâ€™t one in the hotel or at least there wasnâ€™t when we were there. If you come out the front door, make 2 rights & walk down that block. There is also a Walgreenâ€™s drug store back there if you forgot anything. There is also a Catholic Church a few blocks away with Masses in English & Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Great People Great Place Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Cabby1FortPierce
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff work very hard for their guests. We would ask a question and they would volounteer their own experience or jump on the phone to get info for us. The rooms are average but clean. The location is only 2 blocks from all the action on Ashford and another block to the beach. Breakfest on the Roof Patio is a delight. Old San Juan is a short taxi (negotiate your fare) or an interesting bus ride. The locals are fun to talk to on the bus and go out of their way to help. Take any advice on local eateries because you'll be pleasantly surprised on quality and price. We are already planning on our return.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay very much!”
Reviews.Author: silverflyer0
Reviews.Content: I read many negative reviews of this hotel and was a bit concerned about staying there. Well, I shouldn't have worried one bit. The room, while small, was clean and neat. The mattress, pillows, blankets were cozy and clean. In-room coffee, tea, cocoa provided. Shower stall rather than tub, but it was clean and lots of hot water. The large picture window enabled us to look out over the area. Breakfast provided on 7th floor rooftop and it was excellent. The coffee was delicious and hot milk was provided for those of us who enjoy cafe au lait. There was an abundance of foods including hot waffles, eggs, breads, hot and cold cereals. Free newspaper, internet, microwave on first floor for guests, extra helpful and friendly staff. Just a short walk to Walgreens for snacks and a mini-market half a block away for wine, etc. We stayed twice, before and after our cruise and we would certainly stay again. We did take the bus from SJ airport. (not recommended). Bus stop just 2-3 minutes from hotel. Same bus takes passengers to old town San Juan. Exact change required. Many nice restaurants within 5-10 min. of the hotel. We were very happy with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for short stay”
Reviews.Author: cogitosum3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise last week. While our 7th floor room was very small, it was fine for 1 night. It was clean, recently painted, and the bathroom was modern with everthing in excellent working order. We even had an ocean view in between the Condado hotels. The location is very good, with just a short walk to Ashford Avenue, the main drag in the Condado section of San Juan and the beaches. There are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance and Domingo at the front desk was helpful in finding them, as well as othe services, such as getting a cab. The rooftop breakfast was very good, with a great view. And all this for just $125!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in condado, good value, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: panedu50
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for 2 nights in San Juan. The hotel is located close to 26 on the way to the airport and about 10 min to El Morro and viejo San Juan. Positives: *Good value. Good location, about 10 min walk to the beach. You can rent a chair for $3.00. The water in that area is rougher than in Vieques, but I saw a couple of people in the water. *Good asian restaurant next door to the hotel. The hotel provides a 10% discount for 3 hotels close by. *Free parking. *Computer and printer accessible in lobby, and you can print your boarding pass for the next day, etc. *Refrigerator in room. *Quiet, nice. *Breakfast included on patio. *Everyone in the hotel was super nice and helpful. Neutral: *If you are looking to walk to viejo San Juan, this is not the hotel for you. I highly recommend. rent a car, and see the rest of Puerto Rico, Fajardo, Viequest. AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “"Top Secret Hotel" says Travelocity - want to know why? Filthy and a Health Hazard”
Reviews.Author: WhatAboutJohn
Reviews.Content: Incomprehensible filth. Mold and Mildew galore. :: BEYOND DISGUSTING :: This hotel was listed as a Travelocity Top Secret - boy, now we know why it's a Top Secret!! Carpet looks like it has NEVER been cleaned (see un-retouched photos). First room they put us in the carpets were filthy and the bedspread was covered with stains. We demanded another room, they complied. Guess what? It was just as bad! The air conditioning BANGED throughout the night and oozed liquid through the vent. Our stay was a combination of business and pleasure - we picked up the Carnival Cruise in San Juan. As it was over the Christmas holiday, all other accommodations around town were booked solid. So we agonized and coughed and wheezed every night of out stay. **Sidenote** We highly recommend the Carnival Cruise. This cruise line knows the meaning of hygienic - every square inch of this massive ship was SQUEAKY CLEAN! Quality Inn El Portal could learn a thing or two from Carnival. But guess what? It ain't gonna happen. Check out earlier reviews here at TripAdvisor. Guests have been complaining about the very same issues since 2003. Do yourself a BIG favor - STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE AS IF IT WERE THE PLAGUE!! Especially if you have asthma and/or allergies.

Reviews.Title: “clean up your act!”
Reviews.Author: trvlover_11
Reviews.Content: The one word that describes this hotel is "dirty." The rugs in the hallways are grossly stained and don't have appeared to have been cleaned in years. They do have a beautiful rooftop breakfast area, but to get there you have to step around bags of trash leaking "God knows what: all over. The stairs that were carpeted were filthy and home to a dead flattened rodent that appeared to have been there a long time. The first room had active mold growths on the ceiling and we were moved to another room that was even smaller, but without mold. I have to say the bathroom appeared clean and the bed was clean as well. This hotel has a good location to stores, restaurants and the beach. This is a no frills hotel, but management needs to step in and clean up their act! We contemplated looking for another hotel on arrival and decided against it as we were only there for one night. I would not stay there again unless changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “Could easily be a good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: trkinamherst
Reviews.Content: My first time to Puerto Rico. Went on business. Everyone I met was so friendly EXCEPT the front desk clerk at the Quality Inn in San Juan who was rude and surly. They have a beautiful rooftop breakfast veranda but the carpeted stairs leading to it had not been vacuumed for weeks. There was a small, furry rodent ground into the carpet. There were plastic trash bags leaking noxious goo on each stairway landing. The first room I was given had two large, active mold growths on the ceiling. I travel a lot and stay at a lot of hotels. This place reeks of bad management. The restaurant on the ground floor attached to the hotel - Bulgao - was 180 degrees different from the hotel; very friendly, professional staff who served up some great ceviche and conch salad. Definitely check out Bulgao for dinner/drinks but don't stay at the San Juan Quality Inn unless/until they change the management there.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time as good as first”
Reviews.Author: scubyfrog
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in El Porto in December,2009 before taking a cruise. The service and people had been marvelous to us,so we decided to stay there again after a business meeting outside San Juan. We arrived late,but were able to get into our room fairly quickly. The room was clean and quite acceptable to us. The location was great for access to some nice restaurants and shops and only a few blocks from the ocean. The breakfast on the roof was quite adequate and relaxing to eat.The hotel stored our luggage after check-out until we were ready to go to leave which allowed us to get in some extra sightseeing. Nice folks,good surroundings and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,open rooftop”
Reviews.Author: pll2215
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was late by the time we flew in and we were all tired. It was my husband and I along with 6 kids. The rooms are small and the light in the bathroom did not work. I fixed it, mostly. The kids thought the bullet hole in the window was really cool. I don't know if that is what it was from, but that's what we told the kids. I don't want this to sound like a bad review, because we really did enjoy it here. The free breakfast was awesome. They have it on the roof top in the open. The view is outstanding! We walked everywhere from here. Picked up last minute supplies at Walgreens and a cool fruit market was near. Staff was friendly and put up with the kids having numerous cups of free cappichano (spelling?). Would stay again! The beds are smaller, like 3/4 size instead of full so we squeezed a little.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wholisa85
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location - about two blocks away from the popular Ashford St and maybe 15 minutes walking distance to La Placita El Mercado. The hotel is a bit older and the rooms are on the smaller side, but it is clean. If you're like me and just need a place to sleep, shower and rest a bit before your next activity, this is the place. It's nothing fancy, but the staff is friendly and knowledgeable about all the tourist attractions and how to best get there. Although not advertised, they do have beach towels if you need some!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRico2010
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, great service and excellent value. Granted this is not your 4 star hotel, but seeing as I was only sleeping and showering here, it was just right for me. The staff are very nice and helpful. The breakfast on the rooftop was a nice addition, coffee, juices, waffles, sausage, cereal, yogurts, hard-boiled eggs and more. Best of all was the location. Quality Inn El POrtal is in the Condado area and 2 1/2 blocks from the beach and lots of shopping. Right off the highway, the taxi touristica's could pull in and out quite easily for front door service. I will stay here again next time I visit Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: ggmon76
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience with Quality Inn last year in Orlando and should have learnt our lesson then, it seems like the general theme through these places is stains...on the walls, on the curtains, on the linen, towels, ceilings - you name it, if you look hard enough you will pretty much find stains everywhere. This hotel is shabby, the rooms were miserable and dirty, the windows are painted shut and the air conditioner was so loud that you couldnt leave it on - on the second night it kept banging every 20 minutes even when it WASN'T on and we had to move rooms at 2 in the morning, then return by 8am to make sure our stuff was moved out of the old room. The maids hoover the hallways at 8am and will try and get in the rooms to clean before 9am - although what they are cleaning is beyond me. It is a good location for the beaches and shops but bad in every other way, its on an intersection made up of 5 sets of traffic lights and the freeway and the constant beeping of horns makes it impossible to sleep - these people beep all night long with there is no let up. The internet didnt work at all while we were there either. The only slight up point was the free breakfast on the terrace but you still have to be careful for the ants on the table where the food is laid out and the milk and yogurts are just left in the sun. All in all i would avoid this place like the plague - we were only there 2 nights but it was a depressing start to that point of our holiday and it wasnt cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner5610
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good, however it is by the entrance and exit of a freeway and is very congested. The hotel shares parking spaces with a restaurant, which made finding a parking space in the evening nearly impossible. There is no security when parking in front of the hotel, my rental car was broken into and everything stolen. I was there on a business trip and needed the internet, however is was not very good and went out for two whole days. The Staff was friendly and tried to assist as much as possible. The hotel is dingy, the carpets in the hallways were dirty and my room was tiny but clean. Because of the parking, location and security I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: sandlawyer
Reviews.Content: Location is a few blocks from seafront with lots of restaurants,casinos and lots of things to do. The staff could hardly have done more for us. Simply wonderful people and great location.

Reviews.Title: “good location and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Pam050
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Juan for 4 nights in June. I had a group of high school seniors. The staff and manager were so accommodating and pleasant to work with. My group felt very safe in this area; parking is tough, but the staff made sure that you had somewhere to park even if they had to give you their parking space! The managerial staff was also excellent in suggesting tour companies,eating establishments and places high school students would enjoy. I highly recommend the Quallity Inn El Portal. By the way, the beds were VERYcomfortable and you have a panoramic view of the city from the complimentary breakfast on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente”
Reviews.Author: svspa04
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying in this hotel. The staff were the friendliest that I have ever encountered in all of my travels. The hotel itself was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The manager was the best hotel manager that I have ever seen. He went out of his way to make sure that my daughter (who was turning 18 while we were there) and I had a truly enjoyable stay. Don't forget to check out the pasteries on the patio above the 7th floor. They were delicious. This was the best vacation that I have ever had and I would stay at this hotel over the Marriott, Hilton, or an all inclusive any day, because of the STAFF - They were truly wonderful. Also, the hotel is very central to whatever you need to do. The buses go past hotel. The beach is two blocks away. If you want to see and experience San Juan Puerto Rico, stay here at this hotel and get the most experience that you can for you money.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: TatoVeroBeachFL
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I had my doubts because of the limited parking space. Then, with the excellent service and orientation as to where the parking spaces were located, I completely changed my opinion. This is a very nice hotel, conveniently located, close to the beach and eateries. Should you want public transportation, the buses pass a couple of blocks from the hotel. The price is right and the personnel is wonderful. We had a great experience. "Thank you El Portal".

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: gulfveteran
Reviews.Content: Internet ready, clean rooms, free coffee at the reception area. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beach is about a 10 minute walk. Eateries all around, some affordable, some a little on the upper scale. Walgreens is 5 minutes away. I don't know how much more you can ask for a budget place. Overall, it was worth the money. I highly recommend. Marlon Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and close to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: pomegranate_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and within walking distance (5-10 min) to Walgreen's, a gas station, and many restaurants. The Condado area is nice, and you can walk down the street to a beach and a nice park. There is limited parking, but there are many streets nearby (residential) where there is ample room. There is free breakfast with waffles, cereal and toast, along with juice and coffee. There is also an excellent gourmet coffee machine in the lobby, which is completely free. Overall, this was a good hotel for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dand978
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for one night before our cruise departed. As others have noted, this is not a 5 star hotel, but it is perfect for its purpose. The location is ok- not a ton of food around and not in the most charming section of Old San Juan. But it was a good location for our tour pick up and then for transportation to the port. It is also within walking distance of the beach. Rooms are a bit small but we fit 4 people in the 3 person room (2 on a twin bed was a bit too much like college, but it was only for one night). The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful in finding what we needed. In short, I would recommend this hotel for short to medium durations and for folks not looking for a ton of perks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Improvement”
Reviews.Author: nycboytroy
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated hotel. I highly recomend. I stayed there once when it was just El Portal and that place was a dump. Quality Inn did a fantastic job with the renovations, and the price of the room is well worth it. Its a place for budget travellers but not a budget accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “not 5 stars but it works!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luna6373
Reviews.Content: despite the reviews i took a chance.i stayed here for 8 days.the check in was good the staff where very outgoing and friendly i got to my room and first of all the plumbing was bad i mean real bad the water in the shower didn't go down quick.but did eventually after a hour or so and the toilet had a mind of its own and sometimes flushed and sometimes didn't and would get clogged often so i asked for another room and they did right away.the staff was helpful with my needs as far as directions and questions.this is not the Ritz but for the most part its clean safe and a place to keep your belongings i spent most of my time site seeing the water never seemed to get real hot in the shower but i hear this is common in Puerto Rico or in this hotel.ive been here 3 times and if you don't want to pay 200 or more a night you have to take chances.this is a good bang for your buck....im coming back for 8 more days and yes i booked it here.they have a wonderful 8th floor terrace used only in the morning for the continental breakfast awesome views of metro condado.but you gotta walk up 2 flights of stairs to get up there but well worth the work. close to everything from old san juan to dance clubs,beaches,restaurants and a 24 hour Walgreen's thats worth it in it self all rooms have fridges and cable t.v. and located in the heart of everything cant beat that if your on a budget or looking for a safe clean place to keep your stuff and sleep.the maids cleaned the room everyday and assisted me with all my needs as well thanks..*since i wrote this this hotel has changed from a private owned hotel to a chain hotel and have remodeled and changed a lot for the better i hope to check it out on my next visit to puerto rico*

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NPSTER
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Staff was very friendly, and were willing to go beyond their duties to give us information. Checked in was fast. Rooms were in very good condition, and everything was in perfect working order, not as stated by previous reviews. Breakfast was ok, althought opted not to eat there due to alot of birds around the area. Hotel location was perfect, a lot of restaurant in the area. Would definetly go back to Quality Inn El Portal

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnitaGBillings_MT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Portal ( now Quality Inn El Portal ) for just one night before our cruise. We had two rooms because there were five of us and both rooms were great. Yes, there were small, but they were very clean. The gentleman at the front desk gave us a suggestion for a great resturant for dinner, and the free continental breakfast on the roof was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for its purpose”
Reviews.Author: mahoneya
Reviews.Content: On a recent layover between NY and the Virgin Islands, my boyfriend and I needed a cheap (ish) place to stay for the night. We had low expectations but didn't want to spend much more than $100 for our holiday time stay. This hotel was perfect. A clean room, friendly staff, and great location gave us exactly the glimpse at San Juan we needed without breaking our bank before we got to our real vacation in the Virgin Islands. We would probably upgrade for a real vacation in PR, but for our purposes, El Portal was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: Nanum
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at El Portal twice, Feb & Apr 07, both 1 nite stays. Price with tax is around $95. Both times we've been in an end-of-aisle room - comfortable, clean, no plumbing problems but definitely in need for some updating. Staff have always been helpful and pleasant. Yes, continental breakfast is fair but that's what it is - a continental, not a buffet breakfast. Location is excellent - easy walk to Ashford Avenue and many dining choices. Taxi from airport runs around $20US, includes the tip. Would stay here again. Did stay at Coral Princess - much nicer, near El Portal but about $40-$50more - better breakfast and has a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandBabs
Reviews.Content: We read so many negative reviews about this hotel we were afraid to stay here. Because we would have lost our deposit we went. All the negative reviews were wrong. The room was clean, it did not smell. There was no problems with the plumbing, no slow draining shower, no odor when flushing the toilet. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast on the terrace, a continental breakfast, assorted pastries, cereal, coffee and juice, was a good beginning to our day. In fact, when our flight was canceled we called them and went right back for another night. I would not hesitate to go back again. Close to the beach and a variety of good restaurants. We found it to be a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: timfdny
Reviews.Content: It seems the hotel has not changed anything since the late 70's. The carpet, the tile, the sheets, the tub, the glass, etc. It is very dirty. The rooftop continental breakfast is a joke. I was booked here for 3 nights, but left after 1. That young man behind the desk was as lazy an employee I have ever seen. He never answered the phone. When I would go to the desk to ask the question, I saw him messing around on-line with video games. Just don't do it. Don't say I didn't warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Barbadosgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location as it provides easy access to the beach, buses, restaurants and shopping. However, the rooms were smelly/musty and very cold (for a Caribbean location). We turned the a/c off and the place was still too cold. The place seemed to be understaffed as well because the guy who took care of the breakfast was also the porter (on duty). This guy's attitude sucked! Although there was a language difference, there is nothing wrong with a smile and a pleasant outlook (this translates in any language). Check out is also horrible (we were in a large group (26) persons and we were asked to bring luggage to the lobby by 11:30 am our flight was 5:50 pm) Imagine 26 persons by maybe 3 pieces each in a small lobby with no seating arrangement or storage facility. It was horrible. The attitude of some of the staff members was totally disgusting. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends. There are nicer, friendlier places to stay in PR. (Because our group was big we did not have much of a choice - we were told).

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! Bad bad bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels throughout the world and when your on the road, you can't expect much. When traveling through Mexico by car, I stayed in $10 per night hotels that were clean, with running water, and had a shower that drained. El Portal is a $100 per night Roach Motel! I made a reservation to stay at El Portal because I thought there was nothing else, but several friends of mine were able to get far better hotels for a much better price. Warning: Do not stay here, even if there is nowhere else to stay. Camp out if necessary. There are hundreds of hotels that are far better and cheaper. The staff was nice, but the hotel is a dump! The shower had no water pressure and the temperature changed from cold to superhot wihtout any warning. The shower did not drain and no amount of complaints can correct that, i'ts a plumbing issue. It was a complete nightmare. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY HERE! The rooms are sooo tiny and the whole entire hotel has a funny, mold like smell. The continental breakfast includes bread, and cereal with powdered milk. To top it all of THERE IS NO HOT WATER! And they had a drainage problem, it took hours for the shower to drain after one person used it, so if you go with another person wake up early unless you want to shower standing in their dirty bath water. There are so many better hotels in San Juan for around the same price.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn El Portal
HotelInfo.Address: 76 Condado Ave, San Juan 00908, Puerto Rico
